intro: Trichodesma angustifolium subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its ornamental value.
